text.title: 5 MUST EAT Pizzas in Tokyo Japan! (restaurant guide) | Jeremy Jacobowitz
text.p: here are five musty pizzas in Tokyo
including my favorite let me tell you
why I told you guys Tokyo has the best
pizza don't question me if you
do just a hate her and it does make
sense it really is a science and the
care and time people take in Japan for
every dish truly shines in Pizza a quick
refresher uh when I see Tokyo style
which all these are it's neopolitan so
Wood Fired super thin and chewy but the
Tokyo spin is more salt more olive oil
and and a twisted a crust you can get
Wilds of Japanese ingredients but not
necessary before we get started though
make sure you are subed so you never
miss a bite videos coming soon from
Toronto Miami bolognia and of course my
hometown of New York City Plus Check
Link in caption for the brand new
newsletter and podcast diving deeper
into my meals with interviews and news
plus new merch hello egg salad sandoo
tees Pizza Studio Tamaki was the most
recommended pizza I was told to check
out I got two pies to try at their new
much bigger location the Tamaki keeps it
simple with fresh milk mozzarella
pecarina Romano basil and cherry
tomatoes which you are told to pop when
it lands in front of you its beauty is
truly in its Simplicity oh
man love that salt love that Char love
that chew really
bright sweet tomatoes on
there and I got the five for AI which
has fresh smoked mozzarella gorgona teio
Grano mascapone and you finish it with
some
honey the crust is just like
unbelievable really cheesy like they
went hard on the cheese which I
appreciate cut a little bit with that
honey M and just like that soft that
softness of that chew with that little
bit of crunch it's literally perfect you
know what good when even it's like
sitting a little cold tastes great oh
what I really appreciated was the
ability to order smaller sizes so I
could try more oh my God that was so
incredibly good it's like everything I
love about Japanese Pizza it yeah they
have some more crazier ones but just
like Beauty in its Simplicity Beauty in
the dough Beauty in the woodart oven
salt the olive oil oh it just like made
me so happy
Sirin con is the pizza that changed my
life when I had it originally and open
up my eyes in Tokyo style blasting
Beatles music and usually a little bit
of weight it's always a must stop for
me only two pizzas on the menu the
margarita of tomato bzo matz and the
marinara with tomato garlic and
oregano oh my wrong Joe is just like
this nice tender soft chew really nice
little bits of charm and it's a bite of
olive oil and salt that I miss more than
anything and that is the key difference
to Tokyo saly it's soft and it's olive
oil oh my God this pizza is
unable the tomatoes are so sweet tastes
amazing and still this one's dripping in
almost more olive oil truly best pizza
I've ever had definitely don't skip
dessert e nice little bittery t to the
sweetness tends all that savory and
apparently they've added a third pie
which means I have to get
[Music]
back similar to Sirin con is SEO which
is also top tier sorry didn't get a ton
of video from there but I promise it's
good pizza marumo is one of the newest
shops in Tokyo from people behind the
Fantastic
sooy while they do have some more
straightforward like this
[Music]
marinara it's the more interesting
toppings on this Tokyo Sal Pizza that
has been getting to clean the Mayo based
Teriyaki boys with kod Dashi Bonito
Dashi teraki sauce chicken homemade Mayo
corn sauce mozzarella and black shimi
which is a seven spice
blend and the cheese based no problem
has Balo mozzarella roasted tofu chicken
Fila tomato coni roasted on almonds and
walnuts crunching alms on top of really
interesting M out of the three the
Teriyaki boys is definitely my favorite
but I just love the dough and the chew
and all of them I really love seeing uh
Pizza Tak in such unique Direction with
these
[Music]
pies strata has been one of Tokyo's best
pizza spots for over a
decade you can get the traditional Tokyo
style but also pies that are a little
more wild I had to try both of course so
I got the margarita with mozzarella
tomato and
basil that thing is just dripping so
much sauce so much olive oil the olive
oil has like a nice little almost like
frutin to it which is really great
beautiful Char so much salt really
really basic
just God it's so good and then the
bismar Roso has monster moella tomato
sauce Sano hamon mushrooms pearo and
eggs I mean ex fat the yolk is amazing
love the mushrooms love this R ham all
just works this beautiful beautiful
beautiful bite I love like the yolk
mixes into that sauce a little
bit earthday salty
fatty so good so truly just like another
incredible pizza here in Japan I love it
so much I think I like the margarita
more I keep like being entranced by like
all these other crazy pies that I see on
the menu not that that pie was so crazy
but you know more different kind of Pies
but then it just as like the beauty of
Tokyo Pizza is it Simplicity and like
you don't need anything more than that
just the marinara just the basil just
the mozzarella just that salt just that
olive oil it is just absolute perfection
doesn't need anything else and I think
like with you know that it's so soft
anyway that even having more things they
made it really hard to eat people hear
knife and fork it I guess I see why cuz
I guess if you ate that second pie and
you didn't have a knife Fork it really
was hard to eat but I I want to I want
to hand I'm going to hand job it so
which one is my favorite I'm struggling
between singot and strata if you want
more of a selection strata is your
choice but for me I think it's got to be
S con so any more spots I miss let me
know in the comments below and if you
made it this far so to be great because
I go in food adventures all of the world
and here are a few other Japanese videos
